raw_text: This is discussed further, along with a good general summary of text semantic similarity work, by (Mihalcea et al, 2006) .Because of the fundamental nature of the semantic similarity problem, there are close connections with other areas of human language technologies such as information retrieval (SaltonandLesk, 1971), text alignment in machine translation (Jayaraman and Lavie, 2005), text summarization (Mani and Maybury, 1999), and textual coherence (Foltz et al, 1998)
clean_text: Because of the fundamental nature of the semantic similarity problem, there are close connections with other areas of human language technologies such as information retrieval (Salton and Lesk, 1971), text alignment in machine translation (Jayaraman and Lavie, 2005), text summarization (Mani and Maybury, 1999), and textual coherence (Foltz et al, 1998).

citing_paper_authors: Antti-Veikko I., Rosti | Spyros, Matsoukas | Richard M., Schwartz
raw_text: Also, a more heuristic alignment method has been proposed in a different system combination approach (Jayaraman and Lavie, 2005)
clean_text: Also, a more heuristic alignment method has been proposed in a different system combination approach (Jayaraman and Lavie, 2005).

raw_text: Other than confusion-network-based algorithms, work most closely related to ours is the method of MT system combination proposed in (Jayaraman and Lavie 2005), which we will refer to as J& amp; L. Like our method, this approach performs word-level system combination and is not limited to following the word order of a single backbone hypothesis; it also allows more flexibility in the selection of correspondence sets during decoding, compared to a confusion network-based approach
clean_text: Other than confusion-network-based algorithms, work most closely related to ours is the method of MT system combination proposed in (Jayaraman and Lavie 2005), which we will refer to as J&L.
